attributes.action: Stop our failing Hospital Trust wasting money & not delivering to all West Herts
attributes.additional_details: We no longer have confidence in the ability or motivation of our local Trust to provide cost effective, patient friendly, accessible hospital services or facilities. They consistently refuse to properly consider a centrally located clear site, where all West Herts people can conveniently access A & E & other acute services. They wish to splash £1.25 billion (£1.1 billion on Watford & £150 million refurbishing St Albans & Hemel) instead of a new central hospital at half the cost & no disruption.
attributes.background: We want the Government to stop West Herts NHS Hospitals Trust spending £1.1 billion on a skyscraper hospital built on the cramped, existing site next door to Watford Football Club. We want a completely new hospital run by a better provider, more centrally located for all the people of West Herts.

rejection.details:
We can only accept petitions about things the Government or Parliament are directly responsible for.

Decisions about new hospital developments are a matter for the relevant NHS Trust, not the UK Government or Parliament.
